problem.p: What are some of the different ways that a building may fail?

div.p: Here are the main ways that a building may fail: bending (too much bending due to wind or earthquake), buckling (too much vertical load), shear (short beams and buildings will be more susceptible to shear failures), overturning, and sliding (overturning and sliding are mainly a function of connections at the base not being strong enough).
